ExplanationOfAllophones: The nasal consonant [n̥] occurs variably in the data in opposition to a [tʰ] in the 3PL person prefix of verbs when the following vowel is nasal... However, nasalization of /tʰ/ is obligatory in nasal contexts in roots like ĩtʰĩ ‘son’...
all instances of this nasal occur before a nasal vowel... and there are no instances of /pʰ/ before a nasal vowel

The liquid phoneme has two realizations: [ɾ] in front of /i/ and /ĩ/ in word-medial position and [l] in all other contexts.
/l/ can also be variably nasalized when followed by nasal vowels
